trans-unit.source: Exchange ActiveSync Device Management | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Exchange ActiveSync Device Management | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Manage mobile devices with Exchange ActiveSync (EAS) management using the Exchange connector
trans-unit.target: Manage mobile devices with Exchange ActiveSync (EAS) management using the Exchange connector

trans-unit.source: Exchange ActiveSync mobile device management with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Exchange ActiveSync mobile device management with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: For Microsoft Intune to directly manage mobile devices, devices must be [enrolled in Intune](get-ready-to-enroll-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For Microsoft Intune to directly manage mobile devices, devices must be [enrolled in Intune](get-ready-to-enroll-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: As an alternative, administrators can enable a more limited management solution that uses Exchange ActiveSync (EAS) management with an Exchange connector.
trans-unit.target: As an alternative, administrators can enable a more limited management solution that uses Exchange ActiveSync (EAS) management with an Exchange connector.

trans-unit.source: Devices can be managed with either on-premises Exchange servers and Exchange Online using Office 365.
trans-unit.target: Devices can be managed with either on-premises Exchange servers and Exchange Online using Office 365.

trans-unit.source: Intune only supports one Exchange connector connection of any type per subscription.
trans-unit.target: Intune only supports one Exchange connector connection of any type per subscription.

trans-unit.source: Exchange access rules for mobile devices
trans-unit.target: Exchange access rules for mobile devices

trans-unit.source: Exchange needs a set of rules that defines what happens when mobile devices attempt to connect to EAS.
trans-unit.target: Exchange needs a set of rules that defines what happens when mobile devices attempt to connect to EAS.

trans-unit.source: These rules are managed in the Intune administration console.
trans-unit.target: These rules are managed in the Intune administration console.

trans-unit.source: [Exchange access rules for mobile devices](exchange-access-rules-for-mobile-devices.md)
trans-unit.target: [Exchange access rules for mobile devices](exchange-access-rules-for-mobile-devices.md)

trans-unit.source: Install the Exchange connector
trans-unit.target: Install the Exchange connector

trans-unit.source: The Exchange connector lets you manage your Exchange deployment in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: The Exchange connector lets you manage your Exchange deployment in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: You must first install and configure the appropriate Intune-to-Exchange connector.
trans-unit.target: You must first install and configure the appropriate Intune-to-Exchange connector.

trans-unit.source: Choose the appropriate option based whether your Exchange server is on-premises or hosted as a service in the cloud:
trans-unit.target: Choose the appropriate option based whether your Exchange server is on-premises or hosted as a service in the cloud:

trans-unit.source: [Configure the Intune for Exchange Online or new Exchange Online Dedicated environments](intune-service-to-service-exchange-connector.md)
trans-unit.target: [Configure the Intune for Exchange Online or new Exchange Online Dedicated environments](intune-service-to-service-exchange-connector.md)

trans-unit.source: [Install the Intune connector for on-premises Exchange servers and legacy Exchange Online Dedicated environments](intune-on-premises-exchange-connector.md)
trans-unit.target: [Install the Intune connector for on-premises Exchange servers and legacy Exchange Online Dedicated environments](intune-on-premises-exchange-connector.md)

trans-unit.source: Apply policy for Exchange-managed mobile devices
trans-unit.target: Apply policy for Exchange-managed mobile devices

trans-unit.source: The Intune console can be used to manage [EAS policy settings](exchange-activesync-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md) and to [restrict access to company resources](restrict-access-to-email-and-o365-services-with-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: The Intune console can be used to manage [EAS policy settings](exchange-activesync-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md) and to [restrict access to company resources](restrict-access-to-email-and-o365-services-with-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: For a list of Exchange ActiveSync policy settings and features supported by specific mobile devices, see [Exchange ActiveSync Client Comparison Table](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=247270).
trans-unit.target: For a list of Exchange ActiveSync policy settings and features supported by specific mobile devices, see [Exchange ActiveSync Client Comparison Table](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=247270).

trans-unit.source: After connecting Intune to a Microsoft Exchange environment, the EAS policy for all users managed through Intune will be reset to the current default policy on the Microsoft Exchange server, unless a more specific policy is defined within Intune.
trans-unit.target: After connecting Intune to a Microsoft Exchange environment, the EAS policy for all users managed through Intune will be reset to the current default policy on the Microsoft Exchange server, unless a more specific policy is defined within Intune.

trans-unit.source: Wipe company data from mobile devices
trans-unit.target: Wipe company data from mobile devices

trans-unit.source: Finally, you can [wipe company data from EAS-managed mobile devices](wipe-for-exchange-managed-mobile-devices.md) when they are no longer in use, or if devices are lost or stolen.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you can [wipe company data from EAS-managed mobile devices](wipe-for-exchange-managed-mobile-devices.md) when they are no longer in use, or if devices are lost or stolen.
